text.section: In this section, "restriction" means a restriction, moratorium, or capacity limitation imposed on development as a result of a local law enacted under this subtitle.

section.section: If an adequate public facility law has resulted in a restriction within a priority funding area, on or before July 1 every 2 years, a local jurisdiction shall report on the restriction to the Department of Planning.
On or before January 1 every 2 years, the Department of Planning shall prepare and publish a report on the statewide impacts of adequate public facility laws.

The report shall include the identification of:
geographic areas and facilities within priority funding areas that fail to meet local adequate public facility standards; and
improvements to facilities scheduled or proposed in the local jurisdiction's capital improvement program.
